intro: Rostellularia diffusa var. orbiculata, commonly known as the orbiculate rostellularia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its orbicular (round) leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of stipules at the base of the leaves. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
